intro: Pimpinella korovinii, commonly known as the Korovin's cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
